intro: Stenotyla lendyana, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its hairy, sprawling stems and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and linear, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Stenotyla lendyana is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
